newsitem.title: USA: HealthCare COMPARE agrees to buy Loyalty.
newsitem.headline: HealthCare COMPARE agrees to buy Loyalty.

text.p: HealthCare COMPARE Corp said Thursday it signed a definitive agreement to acquire Loyalty Life Insurance Co for a maximum of about $13.5 million, subject to certain conditions.

The transaction will be accounted for as a purchase. Healthcare said Loyalty will have net assets of about $8 million and no net insurance liabilities at the time of the acquisition, which is expected to close in the third quarter of 1997.

Loyalty is an insurer with health insurance licenses in 49 states. It is a subsidiary of Great Southern Life Insurance Co and a member of the Americo family of insurance companies, a $3.5 billion financial service organization.
Healthcare COMPARE said the acquisition is a key element in its strategy of being a national provider of healthcare services and will compliment the company's previous insurance company acquisition.

Completion of the acquisition is subject to certain conditions, including approval by various state insurance regulatory agencies. Following the transaction, Loyalty will operate as a wholly owned subsidiary of HealthCare COMPARE under the name HealthCare COMPARE Life Insurance Co.
